Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • piece.Piece

    IPiece
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPiece
    contains generic piece functionality Superclass for every piece type

    antti

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.Boolean getColour()
      returns the colour of the piece true if black false if white
      java.util.ArrayList<Move> getMoves​(Board board)
      Generic piece does not have any moves
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the string that represents this piece in the command line UI returns x that is supposed to represent any piece on the board this method is used mainly in camera calibration.
      int getValue()
      Returns the current value of this piece to the minMax algorithm generic pies does not have position evaluation
      int getX()
      Returns the x coordinate of this piece
      int getY()
      Returns the Y coordinate of this piece
      void setValue​(int value)
      Sets the value of this piece this does not effect the position evaluation of this piece that is added to this value when get value is called
      void setX​(int x)
      Sets the x coordinate of this piece
      void setY​(int y)
      Sets the y coordinate of this piece
